extendedInfo.description: If you're tired of having to do "team captains" every time you want to change up teams, but don't want entirely random teams either, give this app a try.This team picker is designed for Ultimate Frisbee games.  Team player distribution is based on 7 different player skills and allows selecting which players are there before picking teams.Skills used: height, speed, catching, throwing, defense, competitiveness, experience, endurance.The algorithms used are quick and efficient, and produced fairly balanced teams based on the skill ratings.  It takes only a few seconds to add a player to the database, and only a few seconds more to un-select players not present.Some advanced options are available in the Preferences, as well as turning on a more detailed explanation of the team balances after the algorithm is done selecting players.* Supports 8 different player skills with ratings of 1 to 5.* Add, edit, and delete players.* Pick any number teams.* Select players available for current game.* Force certain players to be paired with or separated (split) from others.* Mark players as inactive to make selecting available players quicker.* Backup, restore, send (e-mail, Dropbox, etc.), and receive/load player database.* Import and export CSV versions of the database.* Easy and lightweight interface.* Can try to make teams' gender distribution equal.* Optional skill weighting.

reviews.title: Nice but would like to group players
reviews.comment: Works well but I play with a few different pickup groups, and it would be nice to be able to group/tag players so when I play with one group I don\'t have to sort through all the players in my other groups. Would also like to see overall player ratings, to make sure I\'ve got the weights and individual ratings calibrated-- it\'s often easier to compare two players overall than on the basis of specific attributes.
reviews.author: Adam Bee

reviews.title: It really works!
reviews.comment: I\'ve used this app several times with my new teams and players, as well as pickup games, and the teams are very balanced. Nice.
reviews.author: Donald Saul

reviews.title: Great App
reviews.comment: I have been using this app every week for several months now and the teams come out perfect.  Highly recommend
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cool app
reviews.comment: Handling is probably the most important skill trait. I\'m not sure if that\'s taken into account or not.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.comment: Works well to pick teams and/or balance lines. Rating each player skill is a much better method vs rating an \"overall\" player score. Capability of keeping players on the same or different teams as well as balancing male/female ratio makes customizing teams easier. Developer support is great!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Working well, good feature set.
reviews.comment: Works well for Ultimate games I\'m a bit biased, as I wrote the app :) After various feature additions and algorithm improvements, I really do think this is one of the best team picking apps. We have anywhere from 15 to 25 players at the moment, and it cuts the picking time down as well as preventing those unfortunate and pesky \"I got picked last\" feelings.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Suggestion
reviews.comment: I had an idea for an ultimate pickup game app that alerts players in the vicinity when a game is going down... just a thought
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good start
reviews.comment: I like where the app is headed. It solves or will solve deficiencies I see in other apps. Looking forward to the next release.
reviews.author: A Google User
